capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-known fact. He was indeed the Potions master during my time there. I remember him being quite intimidating at first, but as you got to know him, he had a softer side.

Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and had a significant impact on the students' education, but at the same time, his behavior towards Harry Potter and other students was often quite... intimidating. (Sentiment: Neutral)
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a bit complicated, to be honest. I mean, he was the Potions master for many years and seemed to have a certain... respect for the school, but at the same time, his behavior towards students was often quite harsh and intimidating. He had a very dark past, you know, and it's hard to separate that from his role as a teacher. I think some people saw him as a bit of a villain, while others might have viewed him as a complex character with a deeper side.
